alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 9:38AM CST until February 22 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Alabama River Near Claiborne Dam affecting Wilcox, Clarke and Monroe Counties. For the Alabama River...including Millers Ferry Dam, Claiborne Dam... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Alabama River Near Claiborne Dam. * WHEN...From late Monday night to Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 42.0 feet, Water begins to inundate the Eureka Landing community. At 43.0 feet, Access to Eureka Landing community stops, with access cut off. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CST Sunday the stage was 38.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Tuesday morning, then to a crest of 42.6 feet Tuesday evening. It is forecast to then fall below flood stage by Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 42.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/mob. The next statement will be issued when updates occur.
